data.message: G as in Graphics, homie. Jif is a peanut butter brand.

replies.message: Hanna Nicole I've read this article before. I'll still say Gif.
Do you say "pine" number when you go to the atm?

Adam Benton No, because there is no E at the end. If there were, then I'd say it. And with Gif, I'll use a hard G because that's what is there. With Jif, I'll use a soft G, because that's what is there. It's not a big deal really 😂
So.... You admit that "G is for Graphics so hard G" is a dumb reason?
Hans Farnbach No? I'm saying that my reason is my reason. Are you really that butthurt over a pronunciation?

You said that you won't pronounce Personal Identification Number the same as "pine" because there's no E at the end of the acronym even though, according to your first post, you must pronounce acronyms the same way as the letters in the words that make up the acronym. 

No "butthurt" over pronunciation, just bad and inconsistent applications of logic.

Hans Farnbach I actually didn't say "G is for graphics"- I said "G as in graphics", to express how I pronounce it the same as the G in graphics. You are looking into this way too hard, it's just an acronym, and how I pronounce it is my choice.

I know how it 'should' be pronounced, but I've always said it with a hard G- it's got nothing to do with logic or whatever. Just 12-year old me pronouncing it that way, and so 18-year old me now will continue to say it that way. 

I can't believe I have to explain why I pronounce a three-letter acronym to some stranger.
